ygData.subject: RE: Great post on item balancing (Long)
ygData.msgSnippet: No, not really.  I just know when I see him he s blue instead of white or yellow.  However, I zoned into SRo the other day and saw a blue SG.  A 33rd DE Necro
ygData.messageBody:
No, not really. I just know when I see him he's blue instead of white or
yellow. However, I zoned into SRo the other day and saw a blue SG. A 33rd
DE Necro girlfriend was with me and I said "Hey there he is! Let's toast
him!" and she said "That's not him." How she knew I don't know because he
was blue to her too. I'll ask her tonight if I remember to.

Crier Sharpsong

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:Dean_Kimes@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, November 30, 1999 4:25 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Great post on item balancing (Long)
>
>
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> I'd love to get a Kilij to replace my Screamer and my group could take the
> SG that drops the plans. Trouble is we can't tell him from the regular
> Habib's that'd g'nite us all for sure. Any ideas on how to tell that a
> particular Habib is 10 levels lower than usual when the little
> one is still
> barely red? Other than walking up to see if he does 30 pts or 80 pts when
> he kicks you?
>
> Kitasi
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: JasonF [mailto:JasonF@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, November 30, 1999 3:15 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Great post on item balancing (Long)
>
>
> From: "JasonF" <JasonF@...>
>
> Hey don't forget the Brazen Brass Kilij! It's what I currently have in my
> offhand. It's 10/35 for a ratio of 3.5. It's only problem is a
> weight of a
> staggering 8.5. When I put this with my 6.5 pound Ugly Stick (tm Rokenn
> Enterprises) I'm wielding 15 pounds of weapons. My yellow bar
> drops pretty
> quickly.
>
> I suppose I should be trying to get a Runed Falchion.
>
> Crier Sharpsong
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:Dean_Kimes@...]
> > Sent: Tuesday, November 30, 1999 3:43 PM
> > To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Great post on item balancing (Long)
> >
> >
> > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
> >
> > From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
> >
> > I could send it pvt but all I need is the best stuff for a melee bard ;)
> >
> > Now for stuff within reason, lets assume less than dual Yaks for
> > now. What
> > can a bard dual wield that is better than Staff o' Writhing and Dragoon
> > Dirk? (some of these combo's I don't know if they are even possible with
> > primary hand restrictions whatever)
> >
> > Staff & Silver axe? Better
> > Staff & Obscidean Shard? Better only with Proc
> > Staff & Obscidean Scim? Not Better
> > Staff & Runed Falchion? Better and Best
> >
> > What is the best? Yes I have all my melee skills maxed.
> >
> > All the betters are ratio only, except shard which is actually
> worse ratio
> > but great Proc.
> >
> > Lower is better.
> >
> > Dragoon Dirk 3.83 the mark to measure against,
> bonuses work in ranged
> > slot
> > Silvery War Axe 3.67 barely better and same weight
> > Obsidian shard 4.17 worse, but that +6 AGI is hard to argue with
> > Obsidian Scimitar 3.9 barely worse, but with a 30pt Proc
> > Runed falchion 3.09 far better
> > Sharkjaw Cutlass 3.2 definitely better and actually lighter at
> > dmg 10
> > Bladed Thulian 3.8 surprisingly close given its 600pp price tag
> > Crystalline Sword 3.45 Fave on Innorukk apparently
> > Polished G Tommy 4.33 Worse, but ok Proc for comparison
> >
> > Staff of Writhing 3.67 for comparison
> >
> >
> > Kitasi
> >
> > > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> > lol@... with the subject submissions.
> >
